de.esoco.lib.net

Class NetUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.net.NetUtil

  • public class NetUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class containing static network helper methods.

      • createSocket

        public static java.net.Socket createSocket(java.lang.String sHost,
                                           int nPort,
                                           NetUtil.SocketType eSocketType)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new socket for the connection to a certain host and port. This method takes into account any system properties for a connection proxy.
        Parameters:
        sHost - The host to connect the socket to
        nPort - The port to connect the socket to
        eSocketType - The type of socket connection to create
        Returns:
        A new socket that is connected to the given host and port
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If creating the socket fails

                                                       int nProxyPort)
                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new SSL Socket that tunnels it's communication through a proxy.
        Parameters:
        rFactory - The factory to create the socket with
        sHost - The host to connect the socket to
        nPort - The port to connect the socket to
        sProxyHost - The host of the proxy to tunnel through
        nProxyPort - The port of the proxy to tunnel through
        Returns:
        The new tunneling SSL socket, initialized and connected to the given host and port
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If creating or initializing the socket fails

      • encodeUrlElement

        public static java.lang.String encodeUrlElement(java.lang.String sElement)
        Encodes a string so that it can be used as an element in an HTTP URL by applying the method URLEncoder.encode(String, String) with the recommended default encoding UTF-8.
        Parameters:
        sElement - sName The name of the URL parameter
        Returns:
        A string containing the encoded parameter assignment

      • encodeUrlParameter

        public static java.lang.String encodeUrlParameter(java.lang.String sName,
                                                  java.lang.String sValue)
        Encodes the name and value of an HTTP URL parameter by applying the method encodeUrlElement(String) to each and concatenating them with '='.
        Parameters:
        sName - The name of the URL parameter
        sValue - The value of the URL parameter
        Returns:
        A string containing the encoded parameter assignment

      • encodeUrlParameters

        public static java.lang.String encodeUrlParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> rParams)
        Creates a concatenated string of multiple HTTP URL parameters that have been encoded with encodeUrlParameter(String, String). The concatenation character is '&', the encoding UTF-8.
        Parameters:
        rParams - A mapping from HTTP URL parameter names to values
        Returns:
        The encoded parameters (may be empty but will never be NULL)

      • getTrustingSocketFactory

        public static final javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory getTrustingSocketFactory()
        Returns a SSL socket factory that trusts self-signed certificates. Attention: this should only be used in test scenarios, not for production code!
        Returns:
        The trusting socket factory

      • wakeUp

        public static void wakeUp(MACAddress rMACAddress,
                          java.net.InetAddress rBroadcastIP)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a Wake-On-LAN packet to a particular MAC address over a certain broadcast IP address on the default port.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        wakeUp(MACAddress, InetAddress, int)

      • wakeUp

        public static void wakeUp(MACAddress rMACAddress,
                          java.net.InetAddress rBroadcastIP,
                          int nPort)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a Wake-On-LAN packet to a particular MAC address over a certain broadcast IP address and port. The broadcast IP is typcially an address that ends with 255 in the same subnet where the machine to be waked up will appear, like 192.168.0.255. It is not the IP of the target machine! This is because that machine is probably inactive and therefore doesn't have an IP address until it has been waked up.
        Parameters:
        rMACAddress - The MAC address of the target network adapter
        rBroadcastIP - The broadcast IP number to send the packet to
        nPort - The port to send the broadcast packet to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the network access fails
